docs.snippet: A team whose payroll ranks near the bottom of the major leagues sent seven players to the annual celebration of baseball, many of whom have taken unconventional routes to success....
docs.lead_paragraph: A team whose payroll ranks near the bottom of the major leagues sent seven players to the annual celebration of baseball, many of whom have taken unconventional routes to success.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column notes that Oakland Athletics, whose payroll ranks near bottom of the major leagues, is sending seven players to the All-Star Game; observes that Oakland model might not work in the Bronx, but it shows, at least, that population of capable players goes beyond free agents with flashy resumes.

headline.main: A’s Creative Mining Floods A.L. Roster With Hidden Gems
headline.print_headline: A’s Creative Mining Floods A.L. Roster With Hidden Gems

docs.snippet: Derek Jeter, who is making his final appearance as an All-Star, drew one of the largest media crowds as well as praise from other players....
docs.lead_paragraph: Derek Jeter, who is making his final appearance as an All-Star, drew one of the largest media crowds as well as praise from other players.
docs.abstract: Baseball Roundup; New York Yankees shortstop Derek Jeter, who is making his 14th and final appearance as an All-Star, draws one of the largest media crowds as well as praise from other players, during the American League batting practice; other news noted.

headline.main: All-Stars Tip Caps to a Finale for Jeter
headline.print_headline: All-Stars Tip Caps as Jeter Prepares for His Finale; Kershaw Is Passed Over

docs.snippet: The All-Star Game’s television audience has been cut in half over the last 20 years, and now the game draws a smaller audience than do many episodes of “The Walking Dead” on AMC....
docs.lead_paragraph: The All-Star Game’s television audience has been cut in half over the last 20 years, and now the game draws a smaller audience than do many episodes of “The Walking Dead” on AMC.
docs.abstract: Richard Sandomir TV Sports column notes that baseball's All-Star Game is soon to overtaken by the Home Run Derby as television event; All-Star Game attracted 22 million viewers 20 years ago; in 2013, it attracted 10.95 million viewers, second fewest recorded by Nielsen; between 1995 and 2013, viewership for the Derby has risen.

headline.seo: Home Run Derby 2014 Looks Enticing Compared to the Main Event
headline.main: Baseball All-Stars Take Field, but Fewer People Tune In
headline.print_headline: Baseball Stars Take Field, but Fewer People Tune In

docs.snippet: Glenn Burke’s family has been invited to Tuesday’s All-Star Game in Minneapolis — recognition of his early role in a movement gaining traction across the sports landscape....
docs.lead_paragraph: Glenn Burke’s family has been invited to Tuesday’s All-Star Game in Minneapolis — recognition of his early role in a movement gaining traction across the sports landscape.
docs.abstract: Major League Baseball is inviting family of Glenn Burke to All-Star Game in Minneapolis; Burke walked away from promising career as an outfielder in 1980 undone mostly by the burden of being a semicloseted gay man; MLB's invitation is part of concerted effort to demonstrate an atmosphere of tolerance and inclusion.

headline.seo: M.L.B. to Recognize Glenn Burke as Baseball’s Gay Pioneer
